Corpuses.Label: English Text
Corpuses.Description: This corpus contains Public domain books provided by Project Gutenberg. These books were chosen to create a test corpus of approximately 10 megabytes that incorporates several dramatically different writing styles.

SourceLinks.Label: The Koran (Al-Qur'an) as translated by G. Margoliuth and J. M. Rodwell
The Adventures of Tom Sawyer by Mark Twain
Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austin
War and Peace by graf Leo Tolstoy

Corpuses.Label: Random Binary Data
Corpuses.Description: This corpus is created as a single 10 megabyte file of pseudorandom binary data. This test was created to test the compression utilities in a "worst case" scenario of compressing completely random data.

Corpuses.Label: Random ASCII Text
Corpuses.Description: This corpus is created as a single 10 megabyte file of pseudorandom ASCII text. This test was created to test the compression utilities in a "worst case" scenario of compressing completely random data.

Corpuses.Label: jQuery
Corpuses.Description: This corpus is composed of current source code for the popular javascript library jQuery. It was chosen as an example of a large repository of computer source code in order to test how the utilities handle somewhat structured data.

Compressors.Label: Compress-Archive cmdlet
Compressors.Description:
The 
Compress-Archive
cmdlet uses the built in Windows zip compressor that is also used by Explorer when sending selections to compressed folders.
7Zip is a popular open-source archiving program supporting a large variety of archive formats and achieves good compression ratios.

Compressors.Label: WinRAR
Compressors.Description: WinRar is a popular closed-source archiving program supporting a large variety of archive formats and achieves good compression ratios.

Compressors.Label: Posix based compressors provided by the cygwin project
Null Compressor
Compressors.Description: The null compressor performs no compression and serves as a baseline to compare other test compressors against
